summary: European governments may be reconsidering their use of U.S. technology and services . The flashpoint came after President Donald Trump sanctioned a prosecutor at the International Criminal Court . In response, Microsoft turned off the prosecutor's email address .  CEO Satya Nadella announced new “sovereign solutions” to protect European institutions this week . The company did not shut down the email accounts of four ICC judges who Trump sanctioned earlier this month .

President Donald Trump is committed to facilitating a rebirth of America's nuclear energy industry . NuScale Power is a leading developer of small modular reactors . Constellation Energy is the largest provider of nuclear power in the United States .  NuScale Power is developing small modular reactors that offer a variety of advantages over conventional nuclear power plants . With $491 million in cash and no debt, the company is on strong financial footing, an appealing situation for those looking to balance a quality growth stock .  NuScale Power says it's the only near-term deployable SMR company with design approval from the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission . Constellation Energy's portfolio includes natural gas, oil, hydroelectric, wind, and solar generation .  Constellation signed a 20-year PPA for nuclear energy that will be generated at the Clinton Clean Energy Center in Illinois . The company is the largest uranium producer based on market capitalization on American stock exchanges .  Cameco stands to benefit as the pathway for developing uranium assets . In 2024, Cameco reported uranium production of 23.4 million pounds . As of the end of 2024, the company reported 457 million pounds of proven and probable reserves . Cameco has the potential to profit from SMR producers like Kairos Power and TerraPower .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . The big winner of the first phase of the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution has clearly been Nvidia . As competition heats up in the AI chips market, cloud services providers could benefit . As the AI revolution rolls on, other companies may supplant Nvidia .  In 2022, Nvidia generated about $27 billion in revenue . As of its most recent quarter, the company reported $130 billion . That's shockingly fast growth, and it's often cited for why Nvidia's share price has risen 800% .  As the market for AI chips becomes more saturated, who will benefit? My investing instincts point to one of the big buyers of AI chips . Amazon, through its Amazon Web Services division, controls around 30% of the cloud services market . Amazon's market share is roughly equal to Microsoft's combined AI chip market share .  Next phase of AI revolution could see the focus shift away from AI infrastructure (GPUs) and toward practical AI . Amazon stock, with its leading position in that key market, could ultimately outperform Nvidia stock in the long term . The cloud infrastructure market is enormous (ataround $700 billion) and red-hot, growing at around 15% year over year . Filecoin is building the 'Airbnb for file storage', says exec Marta Belcher, President and Chair of the Filecoin Foundation, in a recent conversation with TheStreetRoundtable . The goal? Resilience, security, and control, says Belcher .  Filecoin allows anyone in the world to rent out unused storage space and get paid in FIL tokens . Payments on Filecoin are automated, granular, and permissionless . It’s a bold reframe of what blockchain technology can do .  Filecoin is building the 'Airbnb for file storage', says exec . Web3 lets us build systems where rules are baked into code, Belcher said .

Oklo is developing next-gen microreactors that use recycled nuclear waste as fuel . The company is a "pre-revenue" company trading at a sky-high valuation . Oklo went public in May 2024 via a merger with AltC Acquisition Corp., aSPACled by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman .  Oklo's goal of reimagining nuclear power has piqued Wall Street's imagination . The company's first commercial reactor is expected to come online in late 2027 or early 2028 . President Donald Trump issued a flurry of executive orders aimed at jump-starting domestic production of nuclear power .  Oklo is poised to hit the ground running in a sector that's flush with political capital . Oklo's reactor design is modeled after the government's EBR-II, a liquid-metal-cooled, metal-fueled fast reactor .  A unique aspect of Oklo's go-to-market strategy is its build-own-operate model . Unlike traditional nuclear vendors that sell reactors to utilities, Okla plans to build, own, and operate its microreactors . Oklo plans to sell electricity directly to customers via long-term power-purchase agreements .  Oklo isn't just building reactors. It's building a vertically integrated nuclear ecosystem -- from power generation to isotope production . Oklo is an AI play and a clean energy play, with no shortage of potential catalysts to keep running higher .  Oklo recently announced a $400 million secondary stock offering . I'm excited about the technology, but I'd need to see a concrete path to commercialization and revenue . The risk of dilution is always looming . Artificial intelligence could be worth more than $15 trillion over the next decade . Taiwan Semiconductor is the leading manufacturer of advanced AI processors . Microsoft is already benefiting from AI cloud services and is investing $80 billion this year .  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing manufactures an estimated 90% of the world's artificial intelligence semiconductors . This dominance led to TSMC's revenue rising 41% in the first quarter of 2025 to $25.5 billion . TSMC relies on its technological lead in semiconductor manufacturing to stay ahead of its competitors .  Taiwan Semiconductor stock has already gained 142% over the past three years . Demand for semiconductors hasn't slowed down yet, and no one knows when or if it will . Despite its share price gains, TSMC stock has a price to earnings ratio of just 25 .  Microsoft will spend $80 billion on cloud infrastructure this fiscal year alone to stay ahead of the competition . Microsoft is the second-largest public cloud computing provider with 21% market share, trailing onlyAmazon .  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing has a P/E multiple of 36 . Microsoft is setting itself up to remain a leading tech player for years to come . OpenAI is racing against time to restructure its business . Microsoft has invested $10 billion in OpenAI in 2023 . The cloud computing giant has exclusive access to OpenAI’s application programming interfaces (APIs) and models on Azure .  Microsoft's Intelligent Cloud segment, which includes its AI cloud services, generated $105 billion of the company’s $245 billion in total revenue in fiscal 2024 . The two companies are at loggerheads over the terms of a new deal .  OpenAI is looking to block Microsoft from accessing technology from its $3 billion acquisition of AI coding tool Windsurf . Another major issue is how much equity Microsoft would have in OpenAI’s restructured business .  Microsoft has given up exclusivity for OpenAI to use its Azure cloud services . Microsoft now has the right of first refusal for the company . OpenAI began in 2015 as a nonprofit under the name OpenAI Inc., a nod to its mission of advancing humanity .  OpenAI had hoped to shed its nonprofit status to attract additional investors and renegotiate with existing ones . The move would have detached it from its legal responsibility to carry out its original organizational purpose: to "advance digital intelligence in a way that is most likely to benefit humanity" The company was estimated at $300 billion in its latest funding round in March .  Musk is seeking to block OpenAI from converting to a for-profit business . That suit is already set for trial . Musk is also suing the nonprofit's board members and co-founder Sam Altman .

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said on Tuesday that AI will lead to job cuts at his own company . Microsoft declined to confirm the layoffs to Yahoo Finance . The news comes as the two companies invest billions in artificial intelligence efforts .  Some of Amazon's corporate employees are facing an order to relocate closer to their managers and teams . The mandate would require many of them to move across the US to Seattle, Washington DC and other hubs . The comments were met withbacklash from employees .  Amazon has projected it will spend $105 billion on AI infrastructure in 2025 . Microsoft is set to spend $80 billion in 2025 to build out AI data centers . Amazon and Microsoft have both announced layoffs in recent years .  A report last year estimated that generative AI was set to automate nearly 25% of jobs across all industries . Generative AI is set to be set to take over nearly a quarter of all jobs across the globe .
